keyword: how many calories are in jalapenos
title: How Many Calories Are in Jalapenos?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in jalapenos per 100 g, including carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and quick tweaks for recipes.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Jalapenos?
assumptions: Fresh, raw green jalapeno peppers; medium-sized, no seeds removed unless noted.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by ripeness, variety, growing conditions, and preparation. Check labels for processed versions.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of raw jalapenos contain about 29 kcal and 2.8 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Roasted with 1 tsp oil per 100 g
Seeds removed (reduces heat but minor cal change)

faqs.q: How many calories are in one jalapeno pepper?
faqs.a: About 4 kcal per medium pepper (around 14 g).
Yes, 6.5 g carbs per 100 g, with 2.8 g fiber netting ~3.7 g.

faqs.q: Do jalapenos have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal: 0.9 g protein and 0.4 g fat per 100 g.

faqs.q: How does cooking affect calories in jalapenos?
faqs.a: Raw and cooked are similar, but added oils or fillings increase calories significantly.
No, fresh ones have just 3 mg per 100 g; pickled versions are higher.
